com.machinepublishers.jbrowserdriver

Class Settings.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.machinepublishers.jbrowserdriver.Settings.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    Settings

    public static class Settings.Builder
extends Object
    Helps build a Settings object which configures jBrowserDriver. Settings objects can safely be re-used across different instances of JBrowserDriver.
    See Also:
    JBrowserDriver.JBrowserDriver(Settings)

      • screen

        public Settings.Builder screen(com.machinepublishers.jbrowserdriver.Dimension screen)
        Parameters:
        screen - Screen and window size. Defaults to 1000x600. This is a typical size for Tor Browser but if you're not using the Tor user agent you might want to specify a more common size such as 1366x768.
        Returns:
        this Builder

      • userAgent

        public Settings.Builder userAgent(UserAgent userAgent)
        Parameters:
        userAgent - Browser's user agent and related properties. Defaults to UserAgent.TOR.
        Returns:
        this Builder
        See Also:
        requestHeaders(RequestHeaders)

      • timezone

        public Settings.Builder timezone(Timezone timezone)
        Parameters:
        timezone - Timezone of the browser. Defaults to Timezone.UTC. This is the timezone of Tor Browser but if you're not using the Tor user agent you might want to use a locale nearer your actual computer, such as Timezone.AMERICA_LOSANGELES if you're in San Francisco.
        Returns:
        this Builder

      • headScript

        public Settings.Builder headScript(String headScript)
        Parameters:
        headScript - Script to be injected in the HTML Head section. Omit <script> tags; they will be added automatically. Defaults to Settings.HEAD_SCRIPT.
        Returns:
        this Builder

      • proxy

        public Settings.Builder proxy(ProxyConfig proxy)
        Parameters:
        proxy - Proxy server to be used. Defaults to a direct connection (no proxy).
        Returns:
        this Builder

      • downloadDir

        public Settings.Builder downloadDir(File downloadDir)
        Specifies the directory to save downloaded files. If not specified then ./download_cache is created and used. Downloaded files are deleted when the JVM exits, so copy them to a different location to persist them permanently.
        Parameters:
        downloadDir - Where to save downloaded files
        Returns:
        this Builder

      • mediaDir

        public Settings.Builder mediaDir(File mediaDir)
        Specifies the directory to save media files. Calling this method with a non-null File implicitly calls Builder.saveMedia(true) unless you've already called Builder.saveMedia(false). If you do not set a directory here and you've called Builder.saveMedia(true) then the directory ./media_cache is created and used.

        Media is saved as two files in the mediaDir: <identifier>.content (which has the binary content) and <identifier>.metadata (the first line of this file is the original URL of the request for this media, and the second line is the mime type).

        Saved media files are deleted when the JVM exits, so copy them to a different location to persist them permanently.

        Parameters:
        mediaDir - Where to save media files.
        Returns:
        this Builder

      • saveMedia

        public Settings.Builder saveMedia(boolean saveMedia)
        Whether to save media (e.g., images) to disk. Defaults to false but calls to Builder.mediaDir(File) implicitly call Builder.saveMedia(true) unless the File is null or Builder.saveMedia(false) was previously called by you.

        Media is saved as two files in the mediaDir: <identifier>.content (which has the binary content) and <identifier>.metadata (the first line of this file is the original URL of the request for this media, and the second line is the mime type).

        Saved media files are deleted when the JVM exits, so copy them to a different location to persist them permanently.

        Parameters:
        saveMedia - Whether to save media (e.g., images) to disk.
        Returns:
        this Builder

      • build

        public Settings build()
        Returns:
        A Settings object created from this builder.
        See Also:
        JBrowserDriver.JBrowserDriver(Settings)
